Articles.Content:
My first day with the new(ish) space planes. Decided to make a virgin galacticesque ship that could orbit. Named it Black Sorcerer II because i figured a black sorcerer was the opposite of a white knight . Final product can maintain a low a orbit and then can de-orbit and land with a glide (if you\'re lucky). In the pictures you can see that i\'ve recently added a second set of RCS onto the back (You can see them in the ground picture but not in the orbital ones, however i did successfully put the current one in orbit too).

Flight help

I\'d love to see any tips you guys come up with about how to make this fly even better but if you can\'t get it to fly here\'s how i did it.

- Keep SAS on all the way down the runway until the plane is about to fall off the end

- Pull up right before the end and disable SAS

- Tilt up to about 70 then re-enable SAS

- Continue till you start to lose momentum (about 14000m)

- Keep the nose up and disconnect (the first plane wing section should tap off the back 2 tail-fins then it should flip over the top without damaging the 2nd craft

- Activate boosters and aim almost straight up

- Once out of the atmosphere use normal maneuvers to get into orbit

- If you do everything right you should have about 2 half full tanks while in orbit

Again this is my first orbital space plane and i would love to get any feedback you have, enjoy!

Sad to see my first plane go down with 15 downloads and only one comment.

Also Colmo your biplanes are awesome, they\'re so much fun to fly with a stick.
